The number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in West Sussex so far as at 25 July is 54,920 (6,356.6 cases per 100,000 population). In the seven days to 20 July, there were 4,284 new confirmed cases (495.8 new cases per 100,000). In the seven days to 13 July, there were 2,896 new cases and so the new cases have risen by 48% (1,388 extra cases).
